title: Journalists (And Others) Should Leave Twitter. Here’s How They Can Get Started

last_post.content:
Whether it's malign policy or broken technology, Twitter's disabling of 3rd party apps is only the latest reason why anyone who relies on the bird site should be migrating elsewhere. Mastodon is the best alternative at the moment, but the point is: You cannot trust Elon Musk's -- or anyone else's -- centralized operation.

(Note: I believe journalists (and others) are especially misguided if they stay on Twitter and offer this advice to leave: https://www.techdirt.com/2023/01/04/journalists-and-others-should-leave-twitter-heres-how-they-can-get-started/)

This is fascinating! The Braille Institute has developed a font - free to download - that's designed to be clearer for readers with lower vision.

An example of one of the aspects of low legibility that they tackled attached.

It's named Atkinson Hyperlegible. Atkinson was the Institute's founder - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Atkinson

Here's where you can read about the font and download it: https://brailleinstitute.org/freefont

#Accessibility

Via @tombofnull

These companies sell to police and governments around the world who use it to collect information from the phones of journalists, activists, and dissidents. Both companies' software is well documented as being used in human rights abuses.

Today marks 1 year since the release of Quasiflock, a #GenerativeArt 3D animation of mine, which triggered a few pretty dark months in my life due to the completely unexpected backlash & escalations (via Twitter DMs/email), subsequently leading me to seriously question sharing my opensource work & thoughts for the first time in >20 years... Filed under life lessons!

Anyway, I still love this piece & absolutely loved learning a ton things whilst working on it (this 2022 remake of the 2006 original was also my first larger #ziglang & #WebAssembly project). More info & variations on the project site (choose "open" to view fullscreen, scroll down the page for variations...)

https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/slug/quasiflock

title: Semantic search answers: Q&A against documentation with GPT3 + OpenAI embeddings

last_post.content:
Semantic search answers: Q&A against documentation with GPT3 + OpenAI embeddings

In which I describe a system for using GPT-3 to answer questions against an existing collection of documents, using a combination of embedding-based semantic search and careful prompt engineering

All prototyped together using custom SQL functions and Datasette plugins!

https://simonwillison.net/2023/Jan/13/semantic-search-answers/

The lawsuit against #stablediffusion and #midjourney seems to assume that there's copyright infringement if you blend images that originate from a copyrighted source. Blending seems to be transformative of original content and thus covered as fair use. https://stablediffusionlitigation.com/

Reminder that Elsevier also collects and likely monetizes your data: https://fediscience.org/@erinnacland/109553264296601209

You can join the >20,500 other academics who have pledged to refuse reviewing, publishing, or refereeing for Elsevier here: http://thecostofknowledge.com

#ResearchIntegrity #AcademicChatter

When electronics importer Cara Leon goes missing, private investigator Sam Mujrif is hired by her sister to investigate. Cara is 8 times taller than Sam, but evidence soon points to players much smaller than either of them.

As Sam and his cross-scale colleagues pursue the case, it becomes apparent that Cara’s disappearance is linked to technology with the potential to reshape their whole society, and radically alter the balance of power between the scales.

https://www.gregegan.net/SCALE/SCALE.html

title: Residents in Chicago, Illinois are Reclaiming Vacant Properties

last_post.content:
"For over a year now, [people in Chicago] have been reclaiming vacant properties owned by the Chicago Housing Authority. The city and its private contractors abandoned thousands of units of so-called public housing. They let the pipes burst and the walls mold over, just so they can call them uninhabitable, schedule them for demolition, and sell the lots to the highest bidder.

NO MORE. We are inhabiting the uninhabitable. We have dumpstered our homes.

The houses, many of which were sitting empty for years, have become FREE SPACES that hold so much more than a roof over our heads. They are home to anarchist libraries, food distros, parties, film screenings, dinners, constantly re-arranging affinities, intimacies, and an endless tide of batshit ideas and inciteful possibilities."

#Chicago #Illinois #Housing #HousingCrisis

https://itsgoingdown.org/residents-in-chicago-illinois-are-reclaiming-vacant-properties/

title: Unter freier Lizenz: Inhalte der tagesschau nun bei Wikipedia

last_post.content:
Endlich passiert etwas: Die Tagesschau stellt ausgewählte Inhalte unter die freie Creative Commons - Lizenz CC-BY-SA und macht sie Wikipedia-kompatibel. Damit folgt man dem Vorbild von Terra-X aus dem ZDF.

https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/tagesschau-creative-commons-101.html

title: What is Zero-Shot Classification? - Hugging Face

last_post.content:
Zero shot text classification is the most underrated and useful task for various NLP tasks 😍

These models can predict what a given text is about without explicitly being trained on the classes 🤯 You can use these models off the shelf for topic classification or sentiment analysis, or even use it for labelling! 🏷

Learn more here 👉🏼 https://huggingface.co/tasks/zero-shot-classification

My feature article on "Visualization for the Blind" was just published in the new Jan/Feb 2023 issue of @ACM Interactions. This is a high-level overview of making #visualizations #accessible for #blind individuals, sprinkled with my own personal experiences from beginning in the #a11y space. I even squeezed two Latin quotes in! And thanks to my close collaborator Jonathan Lazar for his mentorship. DOI: 10.1145/3571737 Read the fulltext here (no paywall): https://interactions.acm.org/archive/view/january-february-2023/visualization-for-the-blind

Logistics nerds *must* check out Manifest, Matthew Hockenberry and Colette Perold's platform for mapping and analyzing supply chains. It's amazing, and I especially love how it begins by mapping its *own* supply chain. https://manifest.supplystudies.com/ #criticallogistics #criticalinfrastructurestudies #logistics #scm

title: Moving analyses to the web using Observable and DuckDB

last_post.content:
Finally finished building a visualization on @observablehq based on a spectacular post written by @djnavarro . 🥳

https://observablehq.com/@jzavala-gonzalez/moving-analyses-to-the-web-using-observable-and-duckdb

It uses #duckdb 🦆 to recreate the pieces of #rstats {arrow} ⬅️ code and draws the visualization on a canvas. Makes me wonder how the barrier-to-entry for projects and programming can be lowered by running their code live in the browser.

title: Cellebrite and MSAB - Distributed Denial of Secrets

last_post.content:
RELEASE: Leaked phone forensics software and documentation from Cellebrite (1.7 TB) and MSAB (103 GB). https://ddosecrets.com/wiki/Cellebrite_and_MSAB

These companies sell to police and governments around the world who use it to collect information from the phones of journalists, activists, and dissidents. Both companies' software is well documented as being used in human rights abuses.

If you find this interesting, you might also be interesting in our past releases related to Cellebrite:
https://ddosecrets.com/wiki/Cellebrite_Team_Foundation_Server and https://ddosecrets.com/wiki/Cellebrite_Mobilogy

title: Hate speech rises on Twitter in its largest markets after Musk takeover

last_post.content: I have a story out today with intrepid colleagues on the rise in hate speech in Twitter’s largest overseas markets and the real-world harm coming with it, from voter intimidation in Australia to a canceled interfaith wedding in India. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/01/14/twitter-moderation-cutbacks-impact/

title: ‎The Gray Area with Sean Illing: Is ethical AI possible? on Apple Podcasts

last_post.content:
Highly recommended for all. @timnitGebru is genius at explaining in clear language where the issues are, at connecting her work to others' and at not letting interviewers get away with erroneous presuppositions.

https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/is-ethical-ai-possible/id1081584611?i=1000593166307
